column4: i tried installing the latest version of gparted, but i was told that "uuid library (libuuid) not found", when it is in fact installed
its a version that is not in your ubuntu version?
finally i get an answer from someone. thanks :D. and no, it's 0.3.3
can not find and not installed are not the same
i have default 0.2.5 installed.
in that case, how could i help the installer find it?
compiler*
install your version as gparted depends on important libs and that is most likely why it fails.
did you mean uninstall?
gparted is not an app that should be installed out side of repos
yes and use version in your version of ubuntu
ok. thanks for the help.
also as a side note that is a good reason noone helped you
its unsupported
however, i have another question about gparted.
i want to make my ubuntu partition bigger. i booted from the ubuntu livecd, and opened gparted
then tried resizing the partition (it was unmounted), but it told me that i should look for errors and if possible, fix them
then i did that with "fsck /dev/hdc4", and repeated the earlier procedure. i was given the same error
thats not gparted that is most likely your hardware.
i see. i really doubt that, though :P
